page.title: 11ROADS IN WINTER
page.content: IF BAD WEATHER IS EXPECTED IT WILL AFFECTED THE TWO MAJOR ROADS THE A38 AND THE A380 WHERE THEY RISE OVER THE HALDON HILLS.IN WINTER GRITTING LORRIES MAKE IT THEIR MAIN PRIORITY TO KEEP THE ROADS OPEN WHEN IT SNOWS. IT IS THE LOCAL PHOTOGRAPHERS NIGHTMARE TO BE SENT TO THE TOP OF HALDON OR TELGRAPH HILL TO GET PICTURES OF VEHICLES STUCK IN THE SNOW.THE DEVON COUNTY COUNCIL HAS INSTALLED AT THE TOP OF HALDON HILL ICE DETECTION EQUIPMENT.THIS IS LINKED TO OFFICES IN EXETER AND CAN TELL ROAD ENGINEERS WIND SPEED,AIR AND ROAD TEMPERATURES.THIS MEANS THAT GRIT AND SALT LORRIES ARE SENT WHEN CONDITIONS REQUIRE THEM.THE TEMPERATURE HAS BEEN RECORDED AT THE TOP OF THE HILL 8 DEGREES C LOWER THAN AT THE BOTTOM.
